intro: Phaca potosina, commonly known as the Potosi phaca, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in low-nutrient environments. Its leaves are compound, with small leaflets that help reduce water loss. Phaca potosina is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, contributing to soil fertility in its native habitat.
